title: **A. Construction of query deletion mutants in an Hfr Cavalli donor strain**
body:
:


   A temperature-inducible λ Red cassette in strain DY3303 marked with AmpR \(resistance to ampicillin) is moved by P1 transduction into Hfr Cavalli prior to the construction of query deletion mutation. 





Four critical steps are deemed necessary in the construction of query gene deletion mutation in Hfr Cavalli:

body.title: a)
body: Preparation and generation of linear DNA cassette

body.body: Amplify the CmR cassette \(resistance to chloramphenicol) from the plasmid pKD33 with forward \(5’-AGATTGCAGCATTACACGTCTT-3’) and reverse \(5’-GGCTGACATGGGAATTAGC-3’) primers.
Purify the amplified linear DNA using a Qiagen purification kit.
Design the linear DNA cassette to replace the target gene intended for deletion with CmR marker.

Generate the cassette by PCR using 20-nt forward \(5’ GCGTGTTACGGTGAAAACCT-3’) and reverse \(5’-TCGTCGTGGTATTCACTCCA- 3’) primers homologous to the 3’ end of the CmR cassette, and 45-nt at 5’ end that are homologous to the sequences flanking the target gene intended for deletion.
The generated linear cassette is used as template for all subsequent PCRs.
Grow Hfr Cavalli strain carrying λ Red cassette in 50 ml LB medium with ampicillin at 32 ºC to an OD of ~0.4 to 0.6 at 600 nm.
Mix two microliter of the amplified PCR product of CmR cassette with 50 µl of the competent cells.
Electroporate the amplified PCR product of CmR cassette and the competent cells in an ice-cold 0.2 cm cuvette at 2.5KV with 25µF and 200 ohms.
Add immediately 1 ml SOC medium, to allow entry of the linear CmR cassette.
Incubate the cells at 32 ºC for at least 1 hr with shaking at 220 rpm.
About 100 µl of the electroporated cell mixture is spread onto an agar LB plate containing 12.5 µg/ml of chloramphenicol.
Incubate the spread plates at 32 ºC overnight
Pick the positive clones and confirm the recombinants.
Knock out mutant is confirmed by isolating genomic DNA from two random recombinant clones.

The DNA is amplified with two sets of knock out confirmation primers: The first set consists of 20-nt flanking primer located 200 base pairs upstream of the deleted region and one internal primer complementary to the CmR cassette. The second set involves the same upstream probe, paired with another 20-nt flanking primer located 200 base pairs downstream of the deletion to verify the correct mutation.
The amplified PCR products are run on a 1% agarose gel electrophoresis to confirm the correct product size of the amplicon.

body.title: d)
body: Storage of confirmed query deletion mutants

body.body: Two randomly selected and successfully confirmed recombinant clones for each query deletion mutants is stored in cryovials containing 1.5 ml LB medium supplemented with 12.5 µg/ml chloramphenicol and 15% glycerol.

title: **B. Construction of double mutants in E. coli using an automated strain handling arraying procedure**
body: A six-day replica plating method is used to construct double mutants in a high throughput manner.

body.body: First day, the frozen glycerol stock cultures of query deletion mutant created in an Hfr strain with the target gene replacement with CmR is grown overnight at 32 ºC in rich LB liquid media supplemented with 34 µg/ml of chloramphenicol prior to pinning the cultures at 384 density.

Second day, the overnight culture of the query deletion mutant, and the frozen glycerol stock culture from an ordered array of recipient deletion mutant, marked with KanR \(resistance to kanamycin), is pinned onto a LB plate supplemented with 34 µg/ml chloramphenicol and 50 µg/ml kanamycin, respectively at 384 density \(24 column x 16 row) using four 96-well long pins.
Third day, conjugation is carried out onto a LB plate by pinning the overnight query and recipient deletion mutants at a 384 density using 384-well solid pins.

Fourth day, conjugants are subjected to first round of selection onto a LB plate supplemented with chloramphenicol and kanamycin antibiotics. On this day, two 384 colony density conjugation plates are combined in duplicate onto a double drug plate to create 1,536 colony density plates.
Fifth day, the colonies from the first double drug selection plate is pinned onto a second double drug selection plate.

Sixth day, the colonies from second double drug plate is photographed using a Canon Powershot A640 \(10 Megapixels) digital camera. The captured images were saved as jpeg files and growth phenotype of the double mutants is quantitatively assayed using an in-house automated image processing system originally devised for yeast \(Collins et al., 2006). In each step of the above process, the plates are incubated for 24 hrs at 32 ºC.
